summary: This document is a JPMorgan Chase bank statement for Ghislaine Maxwell's Premier Checking account for the period June 1-29, 2007. It shows significant financial activity, including a $7.4 million transfer from an account associated with Jeffrey Epstein, payroll deposits from NES LLC, and numerous check payments. It was filed as a government exhibit in a criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary account holder for the JPMorgan Premier Checking account detailed in this financial statement.

persons.name: Francisco Villacis
persons.context: Listed as a member of Ghislaine Maxwell's JPMorgan Private Bank team.

connections.description: Epstein initiated a $7.4 million wire transfer to Maxwell's bank account, indicating a significant financial transaction between them.
Villacis is listed as a member of Maxwell's JPMorgan Private Bank team, indicating a banker-client relationship.
Dalton is listed as a member of Maxwell's JPMorgan Private Bank team, indicating a banker-client relationship.

events.title: $7.4 Million Wire Transfer from Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A wire credit for $7,400,000.00 was deposited into Ghislaine Maxwell's account, originating from Mellon Bank and referencing Jeffrey Epstein in St. Thomas, VI.

events.title: Bank Statement Period Activity
events.description: The statement period shows over $7.6 million in credits and nearly $7.7 million in debits, including payroll deposits from NES LLC and numerous large check payments.

keyFacts: A $7.4 million wire transfer from Jeffrey Epstein to Ghislaine Maxwell's account occurred on June 15, 2007.
Ghislaine Maxwell's account received regular 'PAYROLL' deposits from an entity called NES LLC.
The account statement shows extremely high-volume financial activity, with over $15 million flowing through the account in a single month.
This document is marked as 'GOVERNMENT EXHIBIT 502' in case '20 Cr. 330 (AJN)', indicating it was used as evidence in a criminal proceeding.
